definitions.definition: Common wormwood ( Artemisia absinthium ), an intensely bitter herb used in the production of absinthe and vermouth , and as a tonic .
The dried leaves and flowering tops of the wormwood plant.

main_definition: ( now rare ) Common wormwood ( Artemisia absinthium ), an intensely bitter herb used in the production of absinthe and vermouth , and as a tonic . [First attested around 1150 to 1350.]
secondary_definitions: The dried leaves and flowering tops of the wormwood plant.
